s.comment: it is unclear what the difference between senses 1 and 3 is sicne both refer to a sequence. this sentence matches the sample sentence of 1 better but the distinction between the two needs to be clarified

list.s: After the emancipation of blacks, the movement for women’s suffrage gained strength and finally triumphed in 1920, and then in unclear succession came the contemporary efforts toward the equal treatment of homosexuals, “illegitimate” children, the handicapped, and even undocumented aliens.

s.comment: this oculd also be globbed since the war of spanish succession refers to one particular event

list.s: Although the British made no military conquests here during the War of Spanish Succession (1700–1713), their negotiators forced the French in the ensuing Treaty of Utrecht to give up all of Acadia (Nova Scotia) except Cape Breton.

s.comment: more context is needed but sense 5 seems closest to capturing the meaning od this sentence

list.s: An orderly succession ...

s.comment: this could also be globbed since it refers to a specific war

list.s: In the subsequent War of the Spanish Succession (1702 –1713) most of the old kingdom of Aragón, including the Balearics, backed the Hapsburgs.

The Habsburg Archduke Charles of Austria challenged France’s Philip of Bourbon in the ensuing War of the Spanish Succession.
The alleys of Patan lead to a succession of half-hidden temples and shrines of great beauty and interest.

s.comment: sense 3 needs to be better distinguished from sense 1 and also seems possible here

list.s: There was a succession of right-wing attempts to govern and Spain floundered in a sea of political strikes and violence.
On the other side of Santiago lies a succession of locally popular beaches, including the long stretch known as Playa Olas Altas, named after the high waves that regularly break here.

s.comment: sense 1 is also possible but the action of the sentence makes sense 3 seem more appropriate, though the two senses should be better distinguished from one another

list.s: In quick succession, they kidnapped British Trade Commissioner James Cross and murdered Bourassa’s Minister of Labor Pierre Laporte.

s.comment: sense 1 also seems possible and very close to sense 3

list.s: It's official: Over the past week, in rapid succession, the editorial pages of both the New York Times and the Washington Post endorsed what the Post called a "disarmingly simple alternative to traditional affirmative action" when it comes to college admissions.
Maybe it's time to plan an orderly succession. ...
